main event: A white light appeared to be hovering at 1000 ft. over St. Ignace, Michigan on January 3, 1955.
interesting points: The object was observed via ground-radar, indicating it was tracked by technical equipment.
The object was reported to be completely stationary and silent during the observation.
The clear night conditions and lack of movement or sound made the sighting potentially an astronomical phenomenon.
The report includes a map submission showing the position of the observed object.
The sighting was reported by a civil source, not a military one.
